text: Reverend Father Auguste Bergy (12 May 1873 - 31 August 1955) was a French Jesuit archaeologist known for his work on prehistory in Lebanon.Auguste Bergy Biography - Lebanese Museum of Prehistory, Saint Joseph University Website He is known particularly for excavations and studies at the Sands of Beirut and at Ras Beirut. In 1930 he discovered Tell Arslan, the oldest known neolithic village settlement in the Beirut area. ==Selected bibliography== * Bergy, Auguste., Le Paléolithique ancien stratifié à Ras Beyrouth, M.U.S.J, XVI, 169-217, 1932. ==References== Category:French Jesuits Category:French Roman Catholic missionaries Category:French archaeologists Category:1873 births Category:1955 deaths Category:Roman Catholic missionaries in Lebanon Category:French expatriates in Lebanon Category:Jesuit scientists
